docs.snippet: The popular first lady, who limits her campaign appearances, is being dispatched to places and constituencies where the campaign is facing the greatest pressure....
docs.lead_paragraph: The popular first lady, who limits her campaign appearances, is being dispatched to places and constituencies where the campaign is facing the greatest pressure.
docs.abstract: Political Memo; First Lady Michelle Obama, who played pivotal role in helping Barack Obama clinch presidency in 2008, is playing similar role for Hillary Clinton in 2016; is making series of appearances in critical battleground areas where Clinton needs support of young and black voters.

headline.main: Want to Know the Crucial Areas for Clinton? Follow Michelle Obama
headline.print_headline: Michelle Obama, the Closer for Clinton

headline.main: ‘Doomocracy’ Puts the Politics of Fear on Display in Brooklyn

docs.snippet: We wouldn’t have let someone with Trump’s returns serve in the cabinet, so how can he be president?...
docs.lead_paragraph: We wouldn’t have let someone with Trump’s returns serve in the cabinet, so how can he be president?
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by former chief White House ethics lawyers Norman Eisen and Richard W Painter argues that Donald J Trump's publicly disclosed partial 1995 tax returns would have disqualified him from nomination to any position in any modern presidential administration; questions his fitness for office of president given his reluctance to release all of his tax returns.

headline.main: The White House Rule: No Tax Returns, No Job

byline.original: By NORMAN EISEN and RICHARD W. PAINTER

docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column wonders why media is neglecting coverage of presidential candidates' climate change policies, when their stark differences could have profound consequences.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

docs.snippet: Indiana State Police are investigating possible voter registration fraud in 56 of the state's 92 counties in a probe that began in August. The investigation is focusing on the efforts of a Washington, D.C.-based voter mobilization group, Patriot M...
docs.lead_paragraph: Indiana State Police are investigating possible voter registration fraud in 56 of the state's 92 counties in a probe that began in August. The investigation is focusing on the efforts of a Washington, D.C.-based voter mobilization group, Patriot Majority USA, which denies any wrongdoing and says it is being unfairly targeted for political reasons. The probe expanded Thursday to nearly two-thirds of the state's counties only days before Tuesday's deadline to register to vote in the state.

headline.main: Some Answers About Indiana's Voter Registration Probe
headline.print_headline: Some Answers About Indiana's Voter Registration Probe
